newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR STARTS TUESDAY SOFTER ON UNITS.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR STARTS TUESDAY SOFTER ON UNITS.

text.p: Early Tuesday import pressure on the Zimbabwe dollar pushed it slightly down against most hard currencies on the interbank market but dealers did not expect it to stray much from its mid-morning levels the rest of the day.

"There was a bit of early morning buying and we went to 11.3180/3280 but now we're starting to see a little bit of central bank intervention to support the dollar and it seems to have stabilised," one dealer said.

"There's one institution still looking to buy (foreign currency) but we shouldn't see our dollar weaken much further. It will all depend on what support level the Reserve Bank comes in at," one dealer said.

At around 0800 GMT the Zimbabwe dollar was trading against the U.S. unit at 11.3135/3235, weaker compared to late Monday's 11.3050/3150 and was at 18.3615/4025 from 18.3400/3600 versus pound sterling.
It eased to 2.5340/5590 from 2.5300/5500 against the rand but was quoted firmer on Germany's mark at 6.5120/5370 compared to 6.5300/5500.
